name: Observable
comment:
Represents an object with observable properties. This is used by data in model-view architectures to notify interested parties of nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.changes to the object's properties (fields or getter/setter pairs).

The interface does not require any specific technique to implement observability. You can implement it in the following ways:

  • extend or mixin this class, and let the application call nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.dirtyCheck periodically to check for changes to your object.

  • extend or mixin nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-change_notifier.ChangeNotifier, and implement change notifications manually by calling nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.notifyPropertyChange from your setters.

  • implement this interface and provide your own implementation.

changes.name: changes
changes.comment:
The stream of change records to this object. Records will be delivered asynchronously.

nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.deliverChanges can be called to force synchronous delivery.

hasObservers.name: hasObservers
hasObservers.comment: True if this object has any observers, and should call nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.notifyChange for changes.

deliverChanges.name: deliverChanges
deliverChanges.comment: Synchronously deliver pending nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.changes. Returns true if any records were delivered, otherwise false.

dirtyCheck.name: dirtyCheck
dirtyCheck.comment: Performs dirty checking of objects that inherit from nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable. This scans all observed objects using mirrors and determines if any fields have changed. If they have, it delivers the changes for the object.

notifyChange.name: notifyChange
notifyChange.comment:
Notify observers of a change.

For most objects nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.notifyPropertyChange is more convenient, but collections sometimes deliver other types of changes such as a nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-list_diff.ListChangeRecord.

Notes: - This is not required for fields if you mixin or extend nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable, but you can use it for computed properties. - Unlike nuxeo_api_playground/observe-src-change_notifier.ChangeNotifier this will not schedule nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.deliverChanges; use nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.dirtyCheck instead.

notifyPropertyChange.name: notifyPropertyChange
notifyPropertyChange.comment:
Notify that the field name of this object has been changed.

The nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.notifyPropertyChange.oldValue and nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.notifyPropertyChange.newValue are also recorded. If the two values are equal, no change will be recorded.

For convenience this returns nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.notifyPropertyChange.newValue.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart:core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.noSuchMethod in an dart:core.Invocation. If nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of nuxeo_api_playground/nx_schema.Observable.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart:core.NoSuchMethodError.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.
